title.value: SAGE: Smart Home Agent with Grounded Execution
title.justification: The title is mentioned at multiple locations in the paper including the header and main body.
title.quote: SAGE: Smart Home Agent with Grounded Execution

extractions.description: This paper introduces SAGE, an LLM-based smart home assistant agent that overcomes common limitations of Large Language Models (LLMs) by using a sequential decision-making process with dynamically constructed LLM prompts and a set of specialized tools for flexible user preference management, device interaction, persistent monitoring, and natural device referencing. The paper also presents a benchmark of 50 challenging smart home tasks where SAGE demonstrates significant performance improvements over existing LLM-enabled baselines.

type.justification: The paper evaluates SAGE on a benchmark of 50 tasks, compares its performance to baselines, and provides empirical results for its success rates and failures.
type.quote: We introduce a benchmark of 50 new and challenging smart home tasks where SAGE achieves a 75% success rate, significantly outperforming existing LLM-enabled baselines’ (30% success rate).

name.justification: The paper focuses on utilizing and augmenting the capabilities of Large Language Models (LLMs), which are a core area of study in Natural Language Processing (NLP).
name.quote: The common sense reasoning abilities and vast general knowledge of Large Language Models (LLMs) make them a natural fit for interpreting user requests in a Smart Home assistant context.

name.justification: The paper discusses the implementation of smart home assistants and their interaction with real-world devices, which falls under Embodied AI.
name.quote: SAGE represents a significant paradigm shift from legacy solutions... and even the next generation of LLM-enhanced versions of such products (e.g. [2]).

name.justification: The paper heavily involves smart home devices and their interactions via APIs, which are central aspects of the Internet of Things (IoT).
name.quote: Most smart home systems (SmartThings, Home Assistant, Google Home, Alexa, etc.) provide APIs for interacting with the smart devices in users’ homes.

name.justification: SAGE is the main model introduced in the paper.
name.quote: SAGE (Smart Home Agent with Grounded Execution), overcomes these and other limitations by using a scheme in which a user request triggers an LLM-controlled sequence of discrete actions.

is_contributed.justification: SAGE is the primary model introduced and evaluated in this paper.
is_contributed.quote: SAGE: The integration of these tools and others into a coherent system with a single entry point, thereby overcoming key inherent limitations of LLMs within the smart home context.

is_executed.justification: The paper describes the execution of SAGE in a real-world smart home setup and its evaluation on different tasks.
is_executed.quote: This demo was executed using real SmartThings-enabled devices.

is_compared.justification: The paper compares SAGE to two LLM-enabled baselines and presents its performance improvements over them.
is_compared.quote: We evaluate SAGE with a number of LLMs and compare it to two LLM-enabled baselines in Section VI, and demonstrate a performance improvement of over 2x

referenced_paper_title.justification: SAGE is introduced in this paper and is not referenced from another paper.

name.justification: The paper introduces a new dataset specifically created to evaluate SAGE on 50 challenging smart home tasks.
name.quote: We introduce a benchmark of 50 new and challenging smart home tasks where SAGE achieves a 75% success rate, significantly outperforming existing LLM-enabled baselines’ (30% success rate).

referenced_paper_title.justification: The SAGE Benchmark dataset is created and used within the scope of this paper.

name.justification: The paper describes using the SmartThings API for interacting with smart home devices as part of the SAGE system implementation.
name.quote: We implement these tools as wrappers around the SmartThings REST API to query and modify device states.

referenced_paper_title.justification: This is the official documentation reference for the SmartThings API used in the paper.

name.justification: Used for voice recognition, which is an integral part of the personalization and human interaction tool in SAGE.
name.quote: User identity is recognized using voice recognition software [13].

referenced_paper_title.justification: This is the official repository for the Vosk API which is referenced in the paper.

name.justification: The paper benchmarks SAGE’s interaction tools against previous work implemented in LangChain.
name.quote: Details on external interaction tools are omitted for brevity, as these types of tools have been well explored in previous work (e.g. in Langchain [6]).

referenced_paper_title.justification: This is the official repository for the LangChain framework which the paper references.
